title: Ticket #6211: Minor problems with Bosco
description:
Two minor issues.

First, when you set it up, the bosco_quickstart says that it's setting up pbs instead of slurm, which could be confusing: 

Type the submit host name for the BOSCO resource and press [ENTER]: fermicloud382.fnal.gov
Type your username on fermicloud382.fnal.gov (default sthapa) and press [ENTER]: sthapa
Type the queue manager for fermicloud382.fnal.gov (pbs, condor, lsf, sge, slurm) and press [ENTER]: slurm
Connecting fermicloud382.fnal.gov, user: sthapa, queue manager: pbs
This apparently carries into the logs as well.

Second, bosco_setenv seems to have an issue on the fermicloud machines, maybe others: 

[fermicloud388] test > source ~/bosco/bosco_setenv
-bash: PYTHONPATH: unbound variable
the error didn't prevent me from running jobs so it's probably superficial, e.g. check for PYTHONPATH and don't try to set it if it's not set or something hmm, looks like this bit of code needs to be changed: 
PYTHONPATH="/cloud/login/sthapa/bosco/lib/python:$PYTHONPATH"
export PYTHONPATH
remarks:
2017-Apr-04 15:12:10 by jfrey:
The first issue was missed in ticket #6106. The second issue stems from ticket #4993 and is not specific to bosco.

2017-Apr-13 10:40:30 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: These changes fit the bill.

2017-Apr-20 10:29:15 by tim:
DOC REVIEW: OK
check_ins:
2017-Apr-19 09:50   Check-in [50508]: Docs for minor Bosco bug fixes. #6211 (By Jaime Frey )
2017-Apr-04 15:19   Check-in [50411]: Fix modification of PYTHONPATH when it's not already set. #6211 If PYTHONPATH isn't already set, just set it to the path we want to add. Otherwise, the value will have an extra colon and bash will throw errors when 'set -u' is enabled. (By Jaime Frey )
2017-Apr-04 15:19   Check-in [50412]: Recognize full slurm support in bosco_quickstart. #6211 (By Jaime Frey )
2017-Apr-04 15:19   Check-in [50413]: Fix grammar error in bosco_findplatform. #6211 (By Jaime Frey )
creator: tim
